notes.text:
Multiple Siemens products are affected by two local privilege escalation vulnerabilities which could allow an low privileged attacker to load malicious DLLs, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution with elevated privileges.

Siemens has released new versions for the affected products and recommends to update to the latest versions.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
notes.title: Additional Resources

notes.text: The use of Siemens Security Advisories is subject to the terms and conditions listed on: https://www.siemens.com/productcert/terms-of-use.
notes.title: Terms of Use

SSA-311973: Multiple Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerabilities in SINEC NMS and User Management Component (UMC) - CSAF Version

document.title: SSA-311973: Multiple Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerabilities in SINEC NMS and User Management Component (UMC)

notes.text:
The affected application permits improper modification of a configuration file by a low-privileged user.
This could allow an attacker to load malicious DLLs, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution with administrative privilege.(ZDI-CAN-28107)
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V4.0 SP2 or later version

notes.text:
The affected application permits improper modification of a configuration file by a low-privileged user.
This could allow an attacker to load malicious DLLs, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges.(ZDI-CAN-28108)
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to V2.15.2.1 or later version
Update UMC to V2.15.2.1 or later compatible version https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/document/109996127/
